result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy J Cannon III

Case called for status.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
02:26 PM Defendant Billy J Cannon in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant qualifies for public defender representation, but an attorney couldn't be appointed in time.
Defendant to reach back out to public defender's office today. 
Case set for status of counsel.
  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:40 PM Defendant Billy J Cannon in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant states he would like to apply to the SPD for representation.
Court advises of right to an attorney.
The Defendant's mother states they did contact the SPD. 
The Court will adjourn.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
01:42 PM Defendant Billy J Cannon in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

The Court removed the date of April 6, 2022 and notified the trial court.  Court addressed defendants case 22CF371 on April 5, 2022 and set matter over until Friday, April 8, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  The defendant was released upon signing a surety bond and the posting of cash bail on 22CF371 and was ordered to turn himself into the State of Illinois.  The Court will tag this matter along with the extradition case for further scheduling.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:23 PM Defendant Billy J Cannon in court, in custody.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
